content.description: This is a fun route with good protection. There are good bolt placement for the crux moves. I don't know any FA info or a name, but it's a great little route, and I think it will improve with traffic. If you have more info on it, please submit.
content.location:
When you get to the base of the crag from the trail, go right. The belay is shaded by small aspens. It is directly to the right of

Flight Days

and just left of

Adigha

.

content.description: This is not a classic, but it is easy. Mostly low angle pockets, the crux is at the obviously steeper section.
content.location:
It is climber's left of

Sleeping But Not Dreaming

.

content.description: This route has interesting climbing that traverses a bit linking up easier features. The crux is at a bulge, and the easiest moves are right of the bolt.
content.protection: Bolts and a two bolt anchor.
content.location:
It is climber's left of

Grand Avenue

, up a small steep hill. This is the first of three bolted lines after the small hill.

content.description: This route is low angle, along with its neighbor. Close bolt spacing makes it a good beginner lead.
content.location:
It is the 2nd route to the left of

Sleeping But Not Dreaming

.

content.description: The crux is definitely down low and seemed way hard for the grade. The 3rd clip seems weirdly placed and may have groundfall potential. The painted sign at the bottom listed this as a 5.9, which jived with the new Western Sloper guide available from Wolverine. Maybe I'm just super weak.
content.protection:
Draws and a two-bolt anchor shared with

Grand Avenue

.
content.location: This is almost immediately to the left of where the climber's trail meets The Schoolyard wall.

content.description: This is a 5.10 sport climb through a bulge - don’t stray left, and enjoy the sequence of pulling bulge directly to make the last clip before the anchor.

Follow a clean panel and crack system for 3 clips before tackling a crux overhang on good pockets and edges. Beware of small loose rock before overhang and occasional falling rock perched above crux to right of anchor (wear a helmet in this zone, especially in the early season).
content.location: This is the rightmost upstream route on the Schoolyard Wall when entering the canyon to park on right hand (north bank) of Lime Creek. Park when you can, and walk back up the road 50 feet looking for cairned trail on left which will deposit you under cliff at a good 5.10 route (Labas). Take a right and walk under cliff passing under 2 other fun routes (Flight Days & Adigha) to reach HPR. Use this approach - there is no trail from Team Wall.

content.description: This moderate is distinguishable by the obvious crack running up the middle.
content.protection:
Draws. A two bolt-anchor is shared with

MK

.
content.location: This is only a few yards to the left of where the climber's trail meets The Schoolyard wall.

content.description:
This climb is located ~50 feet left of

Adigha

in some aspen trees. Three closely spaced bolts on a blank panel mark the start of the climb.

Climb through the first three bolts (crux) to a ledge. To me, the third bolt was a little desperately right, of course (highly likely I could have been off course). Take a breath and enjoy a steep, somewhat juggy finish to the anchors.

The book marks this route as 11a, but the sign at the base says 11d, which I would agree with.
Dizzy Izzy ascends cruiser, low angle slabs with many ledges.
content.location:
Left of

Grand Avenue

, it is the furthest left route on the wall before you go up the small hill leading to

Sleeping But Not Dreaming.

content.description:
This is currently the second furthest right bolted line at the Schoolyard. Begin up a left facing dihedral for 3 bolts and then traverse right to an enjoyable steep, technical face.

Watch the pack rat poo near the third bolt. Moreover, a long draw or runner at the third bolt will reduce rope drag as you traverse right.

Immediately to the right of

Adigha

, this awesome pocketed climb is fairly sustained to the 6th bolt and finishes on a nice ledge fixed with permadraw anchors. If you like pockets and sharp crimps, this is for you. It has 6 bolts to anchors and is 55'.  Right in the aspen gap.
content.location:
This is the first route right of

Adigha

.

Regina cleaning the anchors after the first ascent.
